com.itko.lisa.test

Class SimpleCompanion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.test.CompanionBase
      • com.itko.lisa.test.SimpleCompanion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.itko.lisa.model.IWriteXML, CompanionInterface, NamedType, java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class SimpleCompanion
extends CompanionBase
implements java.io.Serializable
    SimpleCompanion - a simplified way to extend LISA with new companions. Companions can be built in complete/native way and the quick-and-dirty way. This class implements the quick-and-dirty way. You need to subclass this class and register the that class by name. LISA will take it from there
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCustomParams

        public java.lang.Object getCustomParams()
        Description copied from class: CompanionBase
        When a native Test Case XML document is loaded, a mechanism is needed to migrate the actual CompanionInterface object into Editor objects that will read their state and allow them to be edited and saved. This method gets called on you when a Companion of your type has been found in the Test Case. You should query your Companion for its unique attributes and store them into the CompanionController.params (an opaque Object). NOTE: Don't store your attributes into this class!!!!!!! This editor class will have already been given the right CompanionController object via a call to setNodeInfo(). Store the subclass-specific state there. This method shows if this particular companion require some custom settings to migrate it to a companion controller. It defaults to false, so CompanionController can perform the regular migration of adding the Companion as customParams. Otherwise, an editor would be initialized to perform the custom steps.
        Specified by:
        getCustomParams in interface CompanionInterface
        Overrides:
        getCustomParams in class CompanionBase

      • getParameters

        public ParameterList getParameters()
        This is the base implementation of getParameters. You will override this method when you need to tell LISA of your own parameters that need to be provided, but call up to the base class method also! 
         ParameterList pl = super.getParameters();
 pl.addParameter( new Parameter( "New Additional Parameter: ", "mynewkey", "default" ) );
 return pl;
        Returns:
        the parameters that this companion needs for execution

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(ParameterList parameters)
        Assigns the parameters, which may contain custom parameters and parameters injected by LISA (such as type, which indicates the classname of the companion).
        Parameters:
        parameters - this companion's parameters (custom or otherwise)

      • testStarting

        protected abstract void testStarting(ParameterList params,
                TestExec ts)
                              throws TestRunException
        Called when LISA is about to execute the test.
        Parameters:
        params - - the parameters and their values that you requested by provided by the user
        ts - - the state object for the test that's about to start
        Throws:
        TestRunException - if you want to prevent the test from running

      • testEnded

        public abstract void testEnded(ParameterList params,
             TestExec ts)
        Called as LISA is ending the test.
        Parameters:
        params - - the same parameters given when the test started
        ts - - the state object for this test

      • testStarting

        public void testStarting(TestExec ts)
                  throws TestRunException
        Description copied from interface: CompanionInterface
        This method is called by LISA after the TestCase has been loaded and the state object for the given test execution has been initialized, but before the test has begun.

        This is your opporunity to contribute to the TestCase setup. For example, you might need to modify state based on some randomization among a set (which is what the BrowserSelection Companion does).

        Specified by:
        testStarting in interface CompanionInterface
        Parameters:
        ts - is the TestExec (test execution object) that holds the current state.

        Throws:
        TestRunException - when you need to report some kind of fatal error that should halt test execution

        See Also:
        TestExec

      • testEnded

        public void testEnded(TestExec ts)
        Description copied from interface: CompanionInterface
        Thisi is the mirror of the testStarted method; the Test has completed execution, including sending the final event that would normally be sent to all the TestEvent listeners. If you have constructed something at testStarted(), now would be a good time to release it.
        Specified by:
        testEnded in interface CompanionInterface
        Parameters:
        ts - is the TestExec object for the test that just ended

      • initialize

        public void initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element compEl)
                throws TestDefException
        Description copied from interface: CompanionInterface
        This method is called during the construction of a Companion. Once the Companion type tag has been processed, the XML Element is passed to this method for custom XML tag processing.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface CompanionInterface
        Parameters:
        compEl - is the XML DOM for the Filter
        Throws:
